Evaluation.Translational_Status: No substantial change, incremental, or N/A
Evaluation.Executive_Summary: Good progress, consistent use of human cells. Unfortunately, for the most part grantee has been scooped on hNCSC isolation early in the award. The real fruit of the work will be the further study of the isolated cells which can now be pursued. The PI appears to have isolated a different NCSC population that Studer’s HNK-1/p75 population as PIs population appears homogenenously multipotent while Studer’s appears to be a mixed population. Putative hNCSC were isolated from neural epithelium via their migratory behavior. Gene expression profiling reveals differences between these cells and parental clusters, with NCSC markers having increased expression. Notably, these cells retain their developmental potential after several weeks in culture. After microinjection of the cells into aganglionic murine gut segments, differentiation into neurons was observed, although functional coupling has yet to be determined. It would be satisfying to see this type of data to confirm therapeutic feasibility of this cell type. Award to close out. It appears full award has been spent.

Ten_Year_Goal_5.Outcomes: working towards this goal. cells can be made but DMA not yet demonstrated.

Ten_Year_Goal_8.Outcomes: has found a method to both make and expand NCSC (previously described as short lived). this should enable further study of the cells and determination of their therapeutic feasibility.
